str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To make upright (straight) again, rear again, restore. From ana and a derivative of the base of orthos; to straighten up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Plural
str2: From para and hiemi; to let by, i.e. Relax.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To relax, enfeeble, weaken. From para and luo; to loosen beside, i.e. Relax.
The knee. Of uncertain affinity; the 'knee'.
